entries.name: HTML5
summary: First encountered HTML at an early age, worked with it throughout career. Strict on keeping the markup void of implied styling in favour of maximum semantic meaning.
Familiar with HTML5 - new elements, new input types, HTML5 video for example.

entries.name: CSS3
summary: Prefer to use the SMACSS model where possible for good modularity and scalability. Experienced at troubleshooting cross-browser presentation issues.
Proficient with media queries and CSS3 animation.

entries.name: Sass / LESS
summary: Equally capable with both, have used both commercially. Happy with nested styles and inheritance, writing variables, mixins, functions, etc.

entries.name: JavaScript
summary: Compentent object-oriented JavaScript developer - functions, objects, classes, prototype, etc.
Have experience with a wide range of projects with different levels of JavaScript involvement, from web pages requiring mere form validation to large complex webapps driven 90% by JavaScript.

entries.name: AngularJS
summary: Strong knowledge of AngularJS fundamentals and best practices - controllers, directives, services, routing, isolate scope, etc.
I have a non-trivial sample application for inspection that can be found on the Code Samples page.

entries.name: Backbone.js
summary: Excellent understanding and familiarity with the framework - views, models, collections, routers, etc.
I have a handful of projects available for review on the Portfolio page that have been built with Backbone.js.

entries.name: jQuery
summary: Long-standing famliarity. Used to one extent or another on virtually every project.
Have also experimented with jQuery UI on past projects.

entries.name: Require.js
summary: Good project experience of using library for modular and optmial architecture.
Familiar with the r.js optimiser, and AMD substitute almond.js, for building require.js apps for production environments.

entries.name: Handlebars
summary: Fair experience with templating library and have used commercially. Familiar with general syntax and creating custom helper functions.

entries.name: Modernizr
summary: Have deployed many times when extensive feature detection has been necessary on a project. Have often detected features and implemented change via both CSS and JavaScript.

entries.name: Underscore.js / Lodash
summary: More recently preferring Lodash, I sometimes call upon a utility library such as these for general array and object manipulation tasks.
